alert.note: Alert for City of Fredericksburg; Spotsylvania; Stafford (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 09 at 10:45PM EST until January 11 at 5:43AM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Virginia... Rappahannock River at Fredericksburg affecting City of Fredericksburg, Spotsylvania and Stafford independent cities. For the Rappahannock River...including Remington, Fredericksburg, Fredericksburg...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING TO EARLY THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Rappahannock River at Fredericksburg. * WHEN...From Wednesday morning to early Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Water reaches some parking lots near the river in the city of Fredericksburg. Two homes on Sophia Street are flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - There is no current observed data. - Bankfull stage is 10.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow morning to a crest of 17.8 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 18.0 feet on 02/18/1998. - Please visit weather.gov/safety/flood for flood safety and preparedness information && River Name Fld Observed Wed Wed Wed Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time 7AM 1PM 7PM Stg Time Date Rappahannock River Fredericksburg 13.0 MSG unknown 13.2 17.2 17.8 17.8 7pm Wed &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at weather.gov/washington or weather.gov/baltimore. The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning at 1045 AM EST.
